Class BackEnd

  • java.lang.Object
    • BackEnd

  • public class BackEnd
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for doing all back end management required to run the server. Contains methods for opening connections to databases, adding projects, and adding tasks. It also contains methods for the retrieval of information from the database. The intended use of BackEnd is to support LogicEngine and nothing else. A list of important methods in the class includes: createProject, insertTask, setUser, setStatus, getTasks, getProjects,openConnection, closeConnection

      • _dbFile

        public java.lang.String _dbFile

    • Constructor Detail

      • BackEnd

        public BackEnd(java.lang.String dbPath)
        throws java.sql.SQLException
        Creates database if not already created with projects_list. Each instance is ready to handle queries and updates for the database that is input into its system.
        Parameters:
        dbPath - the relative path to the file. May error if program does not have write permissions to location.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - error caused when database is locked, does not exist, or directory does not exist or permissions are not given

    • Method Detail

      • createProject

        public boolean createProject(java.sql.Connection conn,
                    java.lang.String projectName,
                    int tasks)
        Creates a project by inserting it into the list of projects in the database and creating a table for all of the tasks in the project. If project is already created, it replaces the project completely. Note: erases project completely if it already exists so there is an implicit assumption that project names are unique. Prepending with times may be wisest solution to prevent erasing.
        Parameters:
        conn - already opened connection to an sqlite database
        projectName - name of the project wished to be created
        tasks - number of tasks in the project
        Returns:
        whether project was created successfully

      • getAllProjects

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String> getAllProjects(java.sql.Connection conn)
                                                      throws java.sql.SQLException
        Go to the PROJECTS_LIST table and return all of the projects as a list of strings (names)
        Parameters:
        conn - already opened connection to an sqlite database
        Returns:
        string of names. Returns "Failure" as first and only string in list if it fails to read from the database This is weird but also surprisingly useful.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • setStatus

        public void setStatus(java.sql.Connection conn,
             java.lang.String project,
             java.lang.String task,
             int status)
        Set the completion status of a project if the project exists. Cannot be called on nonexistent task
        Parameters:
        conn - already open sqlite database connection
        project - project name
        task - task name
        status - integer status (0 = done, 1 = waiting)

      • setUser

        public boolean setUser(java.sql.Connection conn,
              java.lang.String project,
              java.lang.String task,
              java.lang.String user)
        Set the owner of a task.
        Parameters:
        conn - already open connection to an sqlite database
        project - already created project name
        task - already created task name
        user - the owner to be added
        Returns:
        whether adding owner was successful

      • insertTask

        public boolean insertTask(java.sql.Connection conn,
                 java.lang.String projectName,
                 java.lang.String task,
                 java.lang.String start,
                 java.lang.String end,
                 java.lang.String IP,
                 int port)
        Insert a task into the given project's table of tasks
        Parameters:
        conn - already open connection to sqlite database
        projectName - already created project
        task - name of proposed task addition
        start - beginning time of task
        end - completion time of task
        IP - IP task was set from
        port - port task was set from
        Returns:
        whether task was added successfully

      • isValidDate

        public boolean isValidDate(java.lang.String date)
        Takes an input date and tests it for the specified string pattern. If that pattern is not as expected it returns that the input date is a bad creation of the expected time format.
        Parameters:
        date - start or end time to be evaluated
        Returns:
        whether string represents a properly formatted date or not

      • getTasks

        public java.util.LinkedList<java.lang.String[]> getTasks(java.sql.Connection conn,
                                                java.lang.String project)
        Get all of the tasks in a project and return them as a linked list of string arrays
        Parameters:
        conn - already open sqlite connection
        project - project name
        Returns:
        list of strings. List is single string "Failure" if tasks failed to read. Basically escapes throwing exception.

      • getNumberTasks

        public int getNumberTasks(java.sql.Connection conn,
                 java.lang.String project)
        Get the number of tasks associated with a project
        Parameters:
        conn - already open connection to sqlite database
        project - project name
        Returns:
        number of tasks for project

      • openConnection

        public java.sql.Connection openConnection()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Opens connection to sqlite database with the location given the constructor
        Returns:
        an open sqlite connection to the database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the database is locked or there are concurrency issues

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection(java.sql.Connection c)
                     throws java.sql.SQLException
        Close a connection to the database
        Parameters:
        c - already open connection to database
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if the connection cannot be closed
